policies.name: Risk Management Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing risk assessment practices, risk tolerance levels, and risk management framework
policies.rationale: NIST 03.11.01 requires conducting risk assessments and managing organizational risk, necessitating formal policy guidance on risk management approach

policies.name: Supply Chain Risk Management Policy
policies.description: Policy addressing supply chain risks from external parties, contractors, and service providers
policies.rationale: NIST 03.11.01 discussion explicitly states 'Risk assessments include supply chain-related risks associated with suppliers or contractors'

procedures.name: Risk Assessment Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for conducting comprehensive risk assessments including threat identification, vulnerability analysis, likelihood determination, and impact assessment
procedures.rationale: Control requires systematic approach to 'identifying threats to and vulnerabilities in the system' and 'determining likelihood and magnitude of harm'

procedures.name: Risk Assessment Review Procedure
procedures.description: Process for periodic review of risk assessment results by designated personnel
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.11.01.b requires 'Review risk assessment results [organization-defined frequency]'

procedures.name: Risk Dissemination Procedure
procedures.description: Process for distributing risk assessment results to appropriate stakeholders and decision-makers
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.11.01.c requires 'Disseminate risk assessment results to [organization-defined personnel or roles]'

procedures.name: Risk Assessment Update Procedure
procedures.description: Process for updating risk assessments when significant changes occur or at defined intervals
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.11.01.d requires updates 'when there are significant changes to the system, its environment of operation, or other conditions'

executionEvidence.name: Completed Risk Assessment Reports
executionEvidence.description: Comprehensive risk assessment reports showing: threats identified, vulnerabilities discovered, likelihood ratings, magnitude of harm assessments, CUI disclosure risks, PII processing impact analysis, system boundaries defined, external party risks, supply chain risks, assessment date, assessor signatures
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST requires periodic assessment; annual frequency aligns with SP 800-30 and industry standards for comprehensive risk assessments

executionEvidence.name: Risk Assessment Review Records
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: review date, reviewers, findings discussed, decisions made, action items assigned, review sign-offs
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requirement 03.11.01.b mandates periodic reviews; quarterly review provides timely oversight while balancing resource constraints

executionEvidence.name: Risk Dissemination Records
executionEvidence.description: Evidence of risk communication showing: recipients list, distribution date, acknowledgment receipts, briefing materials provided, stakeholder questions and responses
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requirement 03.11.01.c requires dissemination to designated personnel; timely distribution ensures stakeholders have current risk information

executionEvidence.name: Risk Assessment Update Records
executionEvidence.description: Documentation of risk assessment updates showing: trigger for update (significant change or periodic review), changes identified, updated risk ratings, date of update, approver signatures
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requirement 03.11.01.d mandates updates when significant changes occur or at defined frequency; records demonstrate ongoing risk management

operationalActivities: Conduct comprehensive risk assessments of CUI systems
Identify threats to systems processing, storing, or transmitting CUI
Identify vulnerabilities in CUI systems and infrastructure
Determine likelihood and magnitude of harm from unauthorized access or disclosure
Assess impact of adverse effects on individuals from PII processing
Evaluate supply chain risks from external parties and contractors
Review risk assessment results at defined frequency
Disseminate risk assessment results to designated personnel and roles
Update risk assessments when significant system changes occur
Update risk assessments at organization-defined frequency

policies.name: Vulnerability Management Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing vulnerability scanning frequency, remediation timelines, acceptable risk levels, and vulnerability management lifecycle
policies.rationale: NIST 03.11.02 requires comprehensive vulnerability monitoring and scanning with defined frequencies and response times, necessitating formal policy framework

policies.name: Risk Management Policy
policies.description: High-level policy governing risk-based remediation decisions and organizational risk tolerance
policies.rationale: Control requirement 03.11.02.d requires remediation 'in accordance with an organizational assessment of risk', requiring risk management policy context

procedures.name: Vulnerability Scanning Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for conducting vulnerability scans including: scan scheduling, tool configuration, system coverage, scan execution, results collection
procedures.rationale: Control requirement 03.11.02.a requires 'Monitor and scan for vulnerabilities' at defined frequency and when new vulnerabilities are identified

procedures.name: Vulnerability Analysis Procedure
procedures.description: Process for analyzing scan results including: validation of findings, false positive elimination, severity rating, risk scoring, prioritization
procedures.rationale: Control requirement 03.11.02.c requires 'Analyze vulnerability scan reports and results from vulnerability monitoring'

procedures.name: Vulnerability Remediation Procedure
procedures.description: Process for remediating vulnerabilities including: assignment to responsible parties, tracking remediation progress, validation of fixes, risk acceptance documentation
procedures.rationale: Control requirement 03.11.02.d requires 'Remediate legitimate vulnerabilities [organization-defined response times] in accordance with organizational assessment of risk'

procedures.name: Vulnerability Tool Update Procedure
procedures.description: Process for updating vulnerability scanning tools with latest vulnerability definitions from CVE, NVD, and other sources
procedures.rationale: Control requirements 03.11.02.f and 03.11.02.g require tools with update capability and vulnerability definitions updated before each scan

procedures.name: Vulnerability Information Sharing Procedure
procedures.description: Process for sharing vulnerability findings with designated personnel to help eliminate similar vulnerabilities in other systems
procedures.rationale: Control requirement 03.11.02.e requires 'Share information obtained from vulnerability monitoring process with [organization-defined personnel or roles]'

executionEvidence.name: Vulnerability Scan Reports
executionEvidence.description: Detailed scan reports showing: scan date and time, systems/applications scanned, scanning tool and version used, vulnerabilities identified with CVE/CWE identifiers, CVSS scores, severity ratings, affected assets, scan coverage metrics
executionEvidence.frequency: Weekly to monthly (based on system criticality)
executionEvidence.rationale: NIST requires defined frequency scanning; weekly/monthly aligns with CIS Benchmark recommendations and ensures timely vulnerability identification

executionEvidence.name: Vulnerability Analysis Reports
executionEvidence.description: Analysis documentation showing: validated findings, false positives eliminated, risk assessment for each vulnerability, prioritization decisions, remediation recommendations
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requirement 03.11.02.c mandates analysis of scan reports; timely analysis ensures rapid response to critical findings

executionEvidence.name: Vulnerability Remediation Records
executionEvidence.description: Remediation tracking showing: vulnerability ID, assigned owner, planned remediation date, actual remediation date, remediation method (patch, configuration, mitigation, acceptance), validation testing results, approver signatures for risk acceptances
executionEvidence.freshnessThreshold: Varies by severity: Critical=30 days, High=60 days, Medium=90 days, Low=120 days
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requirement 03.11.02.d requires remediation within organization-defined response times; tiered approach based on CVSS scores and industry standards

executionEvidence.name: Vulnerability Database Update Logs
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: update date, vulnerability definitions added, scanning tool version, CVE/NVD feed version, update verification status
executionEvidence.frequency: Before each scan and at defined intervals
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requirement 03.11.02.g requires updates 'prior to a new scan and [organization-defined frequency]'; weekly updates ensure current vulnerability coverage

executionEvidence.name: Vulnerability Information Sharing Records
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: shared vulnerability details, recipients, sharing date, lessons learned, recommendations for similar systems, follow-up actions
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requirement 03.11.02.e mandates sharing information to help eliminate similar vulnerabilities across organization

executionEvidence.name: Ad-Hoc Vulnerability Scan Records
executionEvidence.description: Records of scans triggered by new vulnerability announcements showing: vulnerability announcement details, affected systems identified, scan results, remediation status
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requirement 03.11.02.a requires scanning 'when new vulnerabilities potentially affecting the system are identified and reported'

operationalActivities: Monitor systems for vulnerabilities at defined frequency
Scan hosted applications for vulnerabilities
Scan all system components including networked devices (printers, scanners, copiers)
Conduct ad-hoc scans when new vulnerabilities are announced
Employ vulnerability tools using CVE/CWE/NVD/CVSS standards
Analyze vulnerability scan reports
Validate scan findings and eliminate false positives
Remediate legitimate vulnerabilities within defined response times based on risk
Make risk-based decisions on vulnerability remediation priorities
Share vulnerability information with designated personnel
Update vulnerability scanning tools with latest definitions
Update vulnerability databases before each scan
Track remediation progress for all identified vulnerabilities

policies.name: Risk Management Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing risk response strategies, risk acceptance criteria, and escalation procedures
policies.rationale: NIST 03.11.04 requires responding to findings from assessments and audits, necessitating formal policy on appropriate risk response approaches

policies.name: Plan of Action and Milestones (POAM) Policy
policies.description: Policy governing when POAMs are required, POAM tracking requirements, and POAM closure criteria
policies.rationale: NIST 03.11.04 discussion explicitly addresses 'generating a plan of action and milestones (POAM) entry' as part of risk response determination

procedures.name: Risk Response Determination Procedure
procedures.description: Process for determining appropriate response to risk findings including: response options evaluation (mitigate, accept, transfer, avoid), cost-benefit analysis, decision criteria, approval workflows
procedures.rationale: NIST 03.11.04 discussion states control 'addresses the need to determine an appropriate response to risk before generating a POAM entry'

procedures.name: POAM Creation and Tracking Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for creating, updating, and closing POAMs including: POAM entry fields, assignment of responsible parties, milestone setting, progress tracking, closure validation
procedures.rationale: Control discussion states 'POAM entry is generated if the risk response is to mitigate the identified risk and the mitigation cannot be completed immediately'

procedures.name: Immediate Risk Mitigation Procedure
procedures.description: Process for rapidly implementing risk mitigations when immediate action is possible, bypassing POAM creation for resolved risks
procedures.rationale: Control discussion states 'It may be possible to mitigate the risk immediately so that a POAM entry is not needed'

procedures.name: Risk Finding Review Procedure
procedures.description: Process for reviewing and categorizing findings from security assessments, monitoring, and audits before determining response
procedures.rationale: Control requirement states 'Respond to findings from security assessments, monitoring, and audits' requiring systematic review process

executionEvidence.name: Risk Response Decision Records
executionEvidence.description: Documentation for each finding showing: finding source (assessment/monitoring/audit), finding description, risk rating, response decision (mitigate/accept/transfer/avoid), decision rationale, approver, decision date, whether POAM created or immediate mitigation performed
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires responding to findings; records demonstrate systematic evaluation and decision-making for each identified risk

executionEvidence.name: Active POAM Entries
executionEvidence.description: Current POAMs showing: finding/vulnerability description, risk rating, assigned owner, planned milestones, target completion dates, current status, progress updates, resources required, dependencies, closure criteria
executionEvidence.freshnessThreshold: Based on milestone dates - items past target dates are concerning
executionEvidence.rationale: Control discussion explicitly references POAM generation for risks requiring ongoing remediation; POAMs track remediation to closure

executionEvidence.name: Immediate Mitigation Records
executionEvidence.description: Documentation of risks mitigated without POAM showing: finding description, mitigation action taken, implementation date, verification of effectiveness, approver signatures
executionEvidence.rationale: Control discussion states risks may be mitigated immediately without POAM; records prove findings were addressed even without formal POAM tracking

executionEvidence.name: Risk Response Status Reports
executionEvidence.description: Periodic reports showing: findings received in reporting period, response decisions made, POAMs created, POAMs closed, immediate mitigations completed, findings remaining open, aging analysis
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates ongoing risk response program effectiveness and provides management visibility into risk remediation progress

executionEvidence.name: Closed POAM Archive
executionEvidence.description: Historical records of closed POAMs showing: original finding, remediation actions completed, closure validation, lessons learned, approver signatures, closure date
executionEvidence.freshnessThreshold: N/A - maintained for audit trail and trend analysis
executionEvidence.rationale: Provides audit trail of risk response effectiveness and supports continuous improvement of security posture

operationalActivities: Review findings from security assessments
Review findings from continuous monitoring activities
Review findings from internal and external audits
Evaluate each finding to determine appropriate risk response
Determine if risks can be mitigated immediately
Create POAM entries for risks requiring ongoing remediation
Document risk response decisions with rationale
Assign POAM owners and establish milestones
Track POAM progress and update status regularly
Implement immediate mitigations when possible
Validate effectiveness of risk mitigations
Close POAMs when remediation is complete and validated
Report risk response status to management
Maintain audit trail of all risk response decisions
